info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 5:21PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cleveland, south central Gaston, northwestern York and northeastern Cherokee Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 521 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Shelby, or near Kings Mountain State Park, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clover, Grover, Sharon, Earl, Smyrna, Kings Mountain State Park, Crowders Mountain State Park, Kings Mountain, Blacksburg and South Gastonia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
